analyzed: langka'i bdag po / de la @301a *//
translated: Lord of Laṅkā,

original: ltos pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: ltos pa gang zhe na /
translated: what is dependence?

original: gang 'dus pa dag skye ba dang / tha snyad kyi phyir rgyu dang / rkyen du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gang 'dus pa dag skye ba dang / tha snyad kyi phyir rgyu dang / rkyen du gyur pa'o //
translated: It is the cause and condition of arising and conventions for those who assemble.

original: bya ba byed pa gang zhe na /🔽de la chos gang thob pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: bya ba byed pa gang zhe na / de la chos gang thob pa'i phyir ram /
translated: What is the performance of functions?🔽It is the cause and condition of attaining a phenomenon

original: grags pa'am / skyes nas las su bya ba'i phyir rgyu dang / rkyen du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: grags pa'am / skyes nas las su bya ba'i phyir rgyu dang / rkyen du gyur pa'o //
translated: or of performing a function after it has arisen.

original: bsgrub pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: bsgrub pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is accomplishment?

original: de la gang go cha bgos pa ste /
analyzed: de la gang go cha bgos pa ste /
translated: It is the armor that is worn.

original: gang smra ba dang / gang nges par shes par bya ba'i phyir rgyu dang / rkyen du gyur pa rnams so //
analyzed: gang smra ba dang / gang nges par shes par bya ba'i phyir rgyu dang / rkyen du gyur pa rnams so //
translated: the causes and conditions for what is to be spoken and what is to be ascertained.

original: langka'i bdag po /
analyzed: langka'i bdag po /
translated: Lord of Laṅkā,

original: de'ang 'di ltar dag pa dang / ma dag pa la gang dag pa ni dmigs pa dang / gnas pa dang / dpe dang / grags pa dang / nges pa'o //
analyzed: de'ang 'di ltar dag pa dang / ma dag pa la gang dag pa ni dmigs pa dang / gnas pa dang / dpe dang / grags pa dang / nges pa'o //
translated: In this way, purity and impurity are as follows: Purity is the focus, the basis, the example, the renown, and the ascertainment.

original: langka'i bdag po /
analyzed: langka'i bdag po /
translated: Lord of Laṅkā,

original: de la thams cad mi rtog pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa ni dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de la thams cad mi rtog pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa ni dmigs pa'o //
translated: Among them, the focus is that everything is nonconceptual, suffering, empty, and selfless.

original: thams cad skad cig ma dang / gzhan yod pa dang / las rnams mi rtag pa dang / las la gnas pa dang / de'i 'bras bu la gnas pa ni gnas pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad skad cig ma dang / gzhan yod pa dang / las rnams mi rtag pa dang / las la gnas pa dang / de'i 'bras bu la gnas pa ni gnas pa'o //
translated: The basis is that everything is momentary, that other things exist, that actions are impermanent, that actions abide, and that their results abide.

original: thams cad la grags pa ni grags pa nye bar sbyor zhing dmigs pa nye bar sbyor ba ni dpe'o //
analyzed: thams cad la grags pa ni grags pa nye bar sbyor zhing dmigs pa nye bar sbyor ba ni dpe'o //
translated: The example is the application of renown and the application of focus.

original: de dag grags pa ni grags pa'o //
analyzed: de dag grags pa ni grags pa'o //
translated: Renown is that which is renowned.

original: gang gi tshad mas tshad ma nyid du snang ba ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshad mas tshad ma nyid du snang ba ni nges pa'o //
translated: Ascertainment is when valid cognition appears as valid cognition.

original: langka'i bdag po /
analyzed: langka'i bdag po /
translated: Lord of Laṅkā,

original: de'ang 'di ltar byung ba dang / brtags dang / gcod pa dang / bral ba dang / snang bas na tshad mar nges pa'o //
analyzed: de'ang 'di ltar byung ba dang / brtags dang / gcod pa dang / bral ba dang / snang bas na tshad mar nges pa'o //
translated: It is ascertained as valid cognition because it arises in this way, is examined, is cut off, is free, and is illuminated.

original: de ni mngon sum dang / dpag pa dang / tshad mas dag pa'o //
analyzed: de ni mngon sum dang / dpag pa dang / tshad mas dag pa'o //
translated: It is pure by means of direct perception, inference, and valid cognition.

original: langka'i bdag po /
analyzed: langka'i bdag po /
translated: Lord of Laṅkā,

original: @301b ma dag pa ni 'di ltar gzhan dang mthun pa dang / mi mthun pa dang / thams cad dang mthun pa dang / mi mthun pa dang / gzhan gyi dpe nye bar sbyar ba dang / ma grags pa dang / ma nges pa dag go /
analyzed: @301b ma dag pa ni 'di ltar gzhan dang mthun pa dang / mi mthun pa dang / thams cad dang mthun pa dang / mi mthun pa dang / gzhan gyi dpe nye bar sbyar ba dang / ma grags pa dang / ma nges pa dag go /
translated: impurity is as follows: it is similar to others, dissimilar to others, similar to everything, dissimilar to everything, and it applies to other examples, is unknown, and is uncertain.

original: langka'i bdag po /
analyzed: langka'i bdag po /
translated: Lord of Laṅkā,

original: de la yongs su dag pa'i mtshan nyid lnga pa ma yin pa'i tshad ma gzhan dang mthun par dmigs pa dang / 'dus byas kyi mtshan ma nyid mi rtag pa la sogs pa ji lta ba la rtag pa dang / bdag la sogs pa gzhan du dmigs te phyin ci log bzhir lta bas 'dus ma byas kyi mtshan nyid dang mthun par dmigs pa 'di ni mthun pa'o //
analyzed: de la yongs su dag pa'i mtshan nyid lnga pa ma yin pa'i tshad ma gzhan dang mthun par dmigs pa dang / 'dus byas kyi mtshan ma nyid mi rtag pa la sogs pa ji lta ba la rtag pa dang / bdag la sogs pa gzhan du dmigs te phyin ci log bzhir lta bas 'dus ma byas kyi mtshan nyid dang mthun par dmigs pa 'di ni mthun pa'o //
translated: The five characteristics of the thoroughly pure are: (1) the observation of the object in accordance with other valid cognitions that are not thoroughly pure; (2) the observation of the characteristics of the conditioned, such as impermanence, as permanence, self, and so on, which is the observation in accordance with the four errors; and (3) the observation in accordance with the characteristics of the unconditioned.

original: tshad ma gzhan dang mi mthun pa dang / yul gyi mtshan nyid gzhan dang mi mthun pa 'di ni gzhan dang mi mthun pa'o //
analyzed: tshad ma gzhan dang mi mthun pa dang / yul gyi mtshan nyid gzhan dang mi mthun pa 'di ni gzhan dang mi mthun pa'o //
translated: The observation that is not in accordance with other valid cognitions and the observation that is not in accordance with the characteristics of the object is the observation that is not in accordance with others.

original: thams cad yid kyi bya ba dag go zhes bya ba ni thams cad dang mthun pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad yid kyi bya ba dag go zhes bya ba ni thams cad dang mthun pa'o //
translated: The statement all are mental activities is in accordance with all.

original: mi mthun pa gang gcig gi mi mthun pas phan tshun mi mthun pa zhes bya ba 'di ni mi mthun pa'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa gang gcig gi mi mthun pas phan tshun mi mthun pa zhes bya ba 'di ni mi mthun pa'o //
translated: The statement that which is not in accordance with one is mutually not in accordance is not in accordance.

original: langka'i bdag po /
analyzed: langka'i bdag po /
translated: Lord of Lanka!

original: gzhan yang / mthun pa dpe dang sbyar ba la mi mthun pa yod pas de ni ma nges pa'o zhes bya ba ni ma grags pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang / mthun pa dpe dang sbyar ba la mi mthun pa yod pas de ni ma nges pa'o zhes bya ba ni ma grags pa'o //
translated: Moreover,🔽it is not well known that the argument, “because there is a disagreement between the example and the similar instance, it is not ascertained,” is not ascertained.

original: mi mthun pa dpe dang sbyar ba la mthun pa yod pas de ni ma nges pa'o zhes bya ba ni de'ang ma grags pa'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa dpe dang sbyar ba la mthun pa yod pas de ni ma nges pa'o zhes bya ba ni de'ang ma grags pa'o //
translated: It is not well known that the argument, “because there is an agreement between the example and the dissimilar instance, it is not ascertained,” is not ascertained.

original: gang ma grags pas gang gis brtags pa ma dag pa'o //
analyzed: gang ma grags pas gang gis brtags pa ma dag pa'o //
translated: That which is not well known is impure in terms of what is imagined.

original: gang rang bzhin gyis ma dag pa ni ma nges pa'o //
analyzed: gang rang bzhin gyis ma dag pa ni ma nges pa'o //
translated: That which is impure by nature is not ascertained.

original: langka'i bdag po /
analyzed: langka'i bdag po /
translated: Lord of Lanka!

original: de dag ni bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ni bsgrub pa'o //
translated: These are the proofs.

original: langka'i bdag po /
analyzed: langka'i bdag po /
translated: Lord of Lanka!

original: chos nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: chos nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is reality?

original: @302a *// gang du ma bcos pa nyid do //
analyzed: @302a *// gang du ma bcos pa nyid do //
translated: It is that which is unfabricated.

original: langka'i bdag po /
analyzed: langka'i bdag po /
translated: Lord of Lanka!

original: gang du bsdus pa dang / rnam par spros bas ni thams cad kyang bsdus te gcig la khyad par gyis phye te mthar phyin pa'o //
analyzed: gang du bsdus pa dang / rnam par spros bas ni thams cad kyang bsdus te gcig la khyad par gyis phye te mthar phyin pa'o //
translated: That which is included and elaborated on includes everything, distinguishing one from the other and reaching the end.

original: langka'i bdag po /
analyzed: langka'i bdag po /
translated: Lord of Lanka!

original: dmigs pa ni 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa ni 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The object is the apprehender.

original: rnam pa ni dbye ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa ni dbye ba'o //
translated: The aspect is the division.

original: byang chub ni rang bzhin no //
analyzed: byang chub ni rang bzhin no //
translated: Awakening is the nature.

original: gang spangs pas gang thob pa ni 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: gang spangs pas gang thob pa ni 'bras bu'o //
translated: The result is what is obtained by abandoning what is to be abandoned.

original: gang chub cing gang la brjod pa ni snyad pa'o //
analyzed: gang chub cing gang la brjod pa ni snyad pa'o //
translated: The designation is what is to be awakened to and what is to be expressed.

original: gang gi phyogs dang mi mthun pa ni bar du gcod pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyogs dang mi mthun pa ni bar du gcod pa'o //
translated: The obstacle is what is not in accord with that.

original: gang gi phyogs la nan tan du byed pa ni mthun pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyogs la nan tan du byed pa ni mthun pa'o //
translated: The concordance is what is to be practiced in accord with that.

original: gang dang mi mthun pa'i dbang du jen pa ni nyes dmigs so; ;gang du mthun par jen pa ni yon tan no //
analyzed: gang dang mi mthun pa'i dbang du jen pa ni nyes dmigs so; ;gang du mthun par jen pa ni yon tan no //
translated: The disadvantage is what is not in accord with that. The benefit is what is in accord with that.

original: langka'i bdag po /
analyzed: langka'i bdag po /
translated: Lord of Lanka,

original: de dag ni mtshan nyid kyis yan lag ste /
analyzed: de dag ni mtshan nyid kyis yan lag ste /
translated: these are the branches by way of characteristics.

original: yan lag drug po de dag ni 'byed pa'i lde mig ste /
analyzed: yan lag drug po de dag ni 'byed pa'i lde mig ste /
translated: These six branches are the keys to the distinctions.

original: gang spyod pas 'dren pa'i sgo gang yin pa de ni des 'byed cing gang de nyid du dgongs pa nges par 'grel to //
analyzed: gang spyod pas 'dren pa'i sgo gang yin pa de ni des 'byed cing gang de nyid du dgongs pa nges par 'grel to //
translated: Whatever is the door to the guide, that is opened by that.

original: langka'i bdag po /
analyzed: langka'i bdag po /
translated: Lord of Lanka,

original: de la mdo bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la mdo bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: what are the four sutras?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: dgongs pa gzhan gyi mdo dang; ldem po ngag gi mdo dang / mthun 'jug sbyor ba'i mdo dang / don dam pa nges pa'i mdo'o //
analyzed: dgongs pa gzhan gyi mdo dang; ldem po ngag gi mdo dang / mthun 'jug sbyor ba'i mdo dang / don dam pa nges pa'i mdo'o //
translated: the sutra of the other intention, the sutra of indirect speech, the sutra of engagement through application, and the sutra of the definitive meaning of the ultimate.

original: langka'i bdag po /
analyzed: langka'i bdag po /
translated: Lord of Lanka,

original: de la dgongs pa gzhan pa'i mdo 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la dgongs pa gzhan pa'i mdo 'di lta ste /
translated: the sutras with other intentions are as follows:🔽 intention regarding nature,🔽 intention regarding time,

original: rang bzhin dang; dus dang / don dang / yul la dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin dang; dus dang / don dang / yul la dgongs pa'o //
translated: intention regarding meaning, and🔽 intention regarding object.

original: langka'i bdag po /
analyzed: langka'i bdag po /
translated: Lord of Lanka,

original: de la rang bzhin ni 'di ltar ji ga khyad par du snang ba la gang de ltar rtog pa zhen pa dag bsal ba'i phyir rang @302b bzhin la dgongs te /
analyzed: de la rang bzhin ni 'di ltar ji ga khyad par du snang ba la gang de ltar rtog pa zhen pa dag bsal ba'i phyir rang @302b bzhin la dgongs te /
translated: regarding nature, it is like this: in order to eliminate the clinging of those who think that the various appearances are real, [the Buddha] intended the nature,

original: de gang yin pa ni 'di nyid do zhes gcig tu zhal gyis rtsal ba'o //
analyzed: de gang yin pa ni 'di nyid do zhes gcig tu zhal gyis rtsal ba'o //
translated: saying, This is just it, and not asserting anything else.

original: langka'i bdag po /
analyzed: langka'i bdag po /
translated: Lord of Lanka,

original: dus ni 'di ltar sgyid lug pa gang dag mngon par spro ba bskyed pa'i phyir gang gi rgyu 'bras mi slu ba la dgongs te gyin 'da' tsam 'dis myur ba nyid du 'gyur ro zhes ston pa'o //
analyzed: dus ni 'di ltar sgyid lug pa gang dag mngon par spro ba bskyed pa'i phyir gang gi rgyu 'bras mi slu ba la dgongs te gyin 'da' tsam 'dis myur ba nyid du 'gyur ro zhes ston pa'o //
translated: regarding time, it is like this: in order to inspire enthusiasm in those who are lazy, [the Buddha] intended the infallible cause and effect, saying, By just this, it will happen quickly.

original: langka'i bdag po /
analyzed: langka'i bdag po /
translated: Lord of Lanka,

original: don ni 'di ltar /
analyzed: don ni 'di ltar /
translated: regarding meaning, it is like this:

original: gang gis gang la rlom sems pa //
analyzed: gang gis gang la rlom sems pa //
translated: Whatever one conceives,

original: de yi mun pa bsal pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de yi mun pa bsal pa'i phyir //
translated: in order to dispel the darkness of that,

original: gang gis mthong lam ma thob par //
analyzed: gang gis mthong lam ma thob par //
translated: whatever one has not attained the path of seeing,

original: de nyid mi mthong la dgongs te //
analyzed: de nyid mi mthong la dgongs te //
translated: Not seeing that,

original: 'di dag ni dpag tu med pa'i dam pas ma bsnyad par shes par mi nus so zhes sgo'o; ;langka'i bdag po //
analyzed: 'di dag ni dpag tu med pa'i dam pas ma bsnyad par shes par mi nus so zhes sgo'o; ;langka'i bdag po //
translated: the door is closed, saying, “These cannot be known without being pointed out by the supreme ones who are beyond measure.”

original: yul la dgongs pa ni 'di ltar gang phyogs gcig tsam gyis chog par 'dzin pa dag blo skye ba'i phyir gang gi phyogs kun bkod de yongs su bsngags pa brjod cing phyogs gcig gis mi chog pa la dgongs te sngon du goms pa'i phyogs la smod pa'o //
analyzed: yul la dgongs pa ni 'di ltar gang phyogs gcig tsam gyis chog par 'dzin pa dag blo skye ba'i phyir gang gi phyogs kun bkod de yongs su bsngags pa brjod cing phyogs gcig gis mi chog pa la dgongs te sngon du goms pa'i phyogs la smod pa'o //
translated: O Lord of Laṅkā, the intention regarding objects is as follows: In order to generate the understanding that one should not be satisfied with just one side, the entire side is set forth, praised, and described, while intending that one should not be satisfied with just one side, one criticizes the side of prior habituation.

original: langka'i bdag po /
analyzed: langka'i bdag po /
translated: O Lord of Laṅkā,

original: de la ldem po dag gi mdo ni /
analyzed: de la ldem po dag gi mdo ni /
translated: the sutra of indirect teachings

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: is as follows:

original: sbyor ba dang / dbye ba dang / zil gyis gnon pa dang / slu ba'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba dang / dbye ba dang / zil gyis gnon pa dang / slu ba'o //
translated: application, division, overpowering, and deception.

original: langka'i bdag po /
analyzed: langka'i bdag po /
translated: O Lord of Laṅkā,

original: de la sbyor ba ni gang 'di ltar gang skrag cing dang ngas pa dang / tshi chad par rtsol ba dang / gang mngon par zhen pa dag ci la'ang mi 'jug pa de dag gang gi don la nges par gzhugs pa'i phyir gang dang / gang gi 'bras bu yod pa dang /🔽kun kyang rang bzhin med pa la dgongs te thams cad yod do zhes @303a *//
analyzed: de la sbyor ba ni gang 'di ltar gang skrag cing dang ngas pa dang / tshi chad par rtsol ba dang / gang mngon par zhen pa dag ci la'ang mi 'jug pa de dag gang gi don la nges par gzhugs pa'i phyir gang dang / gang gi 'bras bu yod pa dang / kun kyang rang bzhin med pa la dgongs te thams cad yod do zhes @303a *//
translated: The application is that, in this way, those who are afraid, who are timid, who are discouraged, and who are attached do not engage in anything at all.🔽In order to establish them in the meaning of that, it is said, “Everything exists.”

original: bya ba dang / stong pa nyid do zhes gang gi 'du shes gzhug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bya ba dang / stong pa nyid do zhes gang gi 'du shes gzhug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is said, “Everything is emptiness,” in order to introduce the notion that everything is ultimately natureless.

original: langka'i bdag po /
analyzed: langka'i bdag po /
translated: Lord of Lanka!

original: dbye ba ni 'di ltar gang dang / gang la mos pa de ltar kun brtags pa dngos po med par bshad pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bshad pa dang / yongs su grub pa mi 'gyur ba phyin ci ma log par bshad pa gsum la dgongs te gsum bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dbye ba ni 'di ltar gang dang / gang la mos pa de ltar kun brtags pa dngos po med par bshad pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bshad pa dang / yongs su grub pa mi 'gyur ba phyin ci ma log par bshad pa gsum la dgongs te gsum bstan pa'o //
translated: The divisions are as follows: The three were taught with the intention of the three: the imagined, which is explained as being unreal; the dependent, which is explained as being dependently arisen; and the consummate, which is explained as being unchanging and unmistaken.

original: langka'i bdag po /
analyzed: langka'i bdag po /
translated: Lord of Lanka!

original: zil gyis gnon pa ni /
analyzed: zil gyis gnon pa ni /
translated: The subjugation is as follows:

original: 'di ltar gang phun sum tshogs pa'i grags pa dag rdzogs longs spyod pa dag bstan pas zil gyis gnon pa'i phyir gnyen por gyur pas 'dul bar dgongs te rgya chen po dag ston pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang phun sum tshogs pa'i grags pa dag rdzogs longs spyod pa dag bstan pas zil gyis gnon pa'i phyir gnyen por gyur pas 'dul bar dgongs te rgya chen po dag ston pa'o //
translated: Thus, in order to subdue those who are to be guided by means of the antidote that outshines the perfect fame of those who are fully endowed with the teachings of the Great Vehicle, the Great Vehicle is taught.

original: langka'i bdag po /
analyzed: langka'i bdag po /
translated: Lord of Lanka!

original: slu ba ni 'di ltar gang 'du shes log pa dag sbas pa'i thabs kyis nges par bsgyur ba'i phyir don mi 'gyur ba la dgongs te rgyur gzhan du ston pa'o //
analyzed: slu ba ni 'di ltar gang 'du shes log pa dag sbas pa'i thabs kyis nges par bsgyur ba'i phyir don mi 'gyur ba la dgongs te rgyur gzhan du ston pa'o //
translated: In order to transform the meaning of the non-changing into something else, the hidden method of reversing mistaken perceptions is taught as a cause.

original: langka'i bdag po /
analyzed: langka'i bdag po /
translated: Lord of Lanka!

original: de la mthun 'jug sbyor ba'i lung 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la mthun 'jug sbyor ba'i lung 'di lta ste /
translated: Regarding that, the scriptural transmission of engagement through conformity is as follows:

original: rang rkyen gnyer gyi lung dang / thabs 'dzud bsre ba'i lung dang / cha mthun sbyor ba'i lung dang / gdams ngag nan tan gyi lung ngo //
analyzed: rang rkyen gnyer gyi lung dang / thabs 'dzud bsre ba'i lung dang / cha mthun sbyor ba'i lung dang / gdams ngag nan tan gyi lung ngo //
translated: The scriptural transmission of individual conditions, the scriptural transmission of combining and mixing methods, the scriptural transmission of applying concordant parts, and the scriptural transmission of earnest advice.

original: langka'i bdag po /
analyzed: langka'i bdag po /
translated: Lord of Lanka!

original: 'di la rang rkyen gnyer gyi lung ni 'di ltar gang la gang ltar rkyen du 'tsham pa de la de ltar nyid ston pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la rang rkyen gnyer gyi lung ni 'di ltar gang la gang ltar rkyen du 'tsham pa de la de ltar nyid ston pa'o //
translated: Regarding that, the scriptural transmission of individual conditions is as follows: Whatever is suitable as a condition for whomever, that is taught to them in that way.

original: thabs 'dzud bsre ba'i lung ni 'di ltar /
analyzed: thabs 'dzud bsre ba'i lung ni 'di ltar /
translated: The scripture of the method of combining and mixing is as follows:

original: gang bsdu ba'i thabs kyis gang gi cha dang 'dren @303b mas de dag bsgyur ba'o //
analyzed: gang bsdu ba'i thabs kyis gang gi cha dang 'dren @303b mas de dag bsgyur ba'o //
translated: The method of combining is that which is mixed with the parts of whatever is combined.

original: cha mthun sbyor ba ni 'di ltar gang gi cha bzhin spyod pas 'di ltar sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: cha mthun sbyor ba ni 'di ltar gang gi cha bzhin spyod pas 'di ltar sbyor ba'o //
translated: The application of the concordant part is as follows: one applies in this way by acting in accordance with the part.

original: gdams ngag nan tan gyi lung ni 'di ltar gang la gang gces spras byas ste 'jog pa'o //
analyzed: gdams ngag nan tan gyi lung ni 'di ltar gang la gang gces spras byas ste 'jog pa'o //
translated: The scripture of the instruction of practice is as follows: one should place whatever is cherished.

original: langka'i bdag po /
analyzed: langka'i bdag po /
translated: Lord of Lanka!

original: de la don dam nges pa'i lung ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la don dam nges pa'i lung ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The scripture of the ascertainment of the ultimate is as follows:

original: dgos pa dang / nges pa dang / ngo bo dang / gal po'o //
analyzed: dgos pa dang / nges pa dang / ngo bo dang / gal po'o //
translated: the purpose, the ascertainment, the essence, and the importance.

original: langka'i bdag po /
analyzed: langka'i bdag po /
translated: Lord of Lanka!

original: de la dgos pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la dgos pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the purpose?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: gang byung ba dag gang gi phyir brtags te de ltar de'i phyir ngos zin pa'o //
analyzed: gang byung ba dag gang gi phyir brtags te de ltar de'i phyir ngos zin pa'o //
translated: whatever arises is examined for the sake of that, and thus it is ascertained.

original: nges pa ni 'di ltar gang la gtan la phab pa de'i nges pa rnyed pa'o //
analyzed: nges pa ni 'di ltar gang la gtan la phab pa de'i nges pa rnyed pa'o //
translated: Ascertainment is as follows: the ascertainment of whatever is determined is found.

original: rang gi ngo bo ni 'di ltar gang brtags pa brjod pa'i dngos gzhi'o //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo ni 'di ltar gang brtags pa brjod pa'i dngos gzhi'o //
translated: The essence is as follows: the main topic of whatever is examined is expressed.

original: gal po ni 'di ltar gang la gang gis gal du gtong pa nyid do //
analyzed: gal po ni 'di ltar gang la gang gis gal du gtong pa nyid do //
translated: The important point is to be concerned with what is important for what.

original: langka'i bdag po /
analyzed: langka'i bdag po /
translated: Lord of Lanka,

original: de dag ni nges pa dam pa'i lung ste /
analyzed: de dag ni nges pa dam pa'i lung ste /
translated: these are the scriptures of the highest certainty.

original: mdo bzhi po de dag ni dgrol ba'i lde mig ste /
analyzed: mdo bzhi po de dag ni dgrol ba'i lde mig ste /
translated: These four sutras are the keys to unlocking the teachings.

original: gang spyod pas 'dren pa'i sgo gang yin pa de ni nges dgrol zhing gang de nyid du gsal bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: gang spyod pas 'dren pa'i sgo gang yin pa de ni nges dgrol zhing gang de nyid du gsal bar byed pa'o //
translated: Whatever is the door through which one is led, that is what is to be unlocked and clarified.

original: langka'i bdag po /
analyzed: langka'i bdag po /
translated: Lord of Lanka,

original: de la rtsa ba gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la rtsa ba gsum gang zhe na /
translated: what are the three roots?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: blo'i rtsa ba dang / gros kyi rtsa ba dang / thabs kyi rtsa ba'o //
analyzed: blo'i rtsa ba dang / gros kyi rtsa ba dang / thabs kyi rtsa ba'o //
translated: the root of the mind, the root of counsel, and the root of means.

original: langka'i bdag po /
analyzed: langka'i bdag po /
translated: Lord of Lanka,

original: de la blo'i rtsa ba ni 'di ltar ji bzhin pa'i de bzhin nyid du mi rtog rnam par mi rtog lhan ne ba'o //
analyzed: de la blo'i rtsa ba ni 'di ltar ji bzhin pa'i de bzhin nyid du mi rtog rnam par mi rtog lhan ne ba'o //
translated: the root of the mind is as follows: it is the non-conceptual, non-differentiating, and clear state of suchness just as it is.

original: langka'i bdag po /
analyzed: langka'i bdag po /
translated: Lord of Lanka,

original: gros kyi rtsa ba ni 'di ltar gang thams cad nas thams cad du ma 'dres pa lam rmongs pa nyid sa la le ba'o //
analyzed: gros kyi rtsa ba ni 'di ltar gang thams cad nas thams cad du ma 'dres pa lam rmongs pa nyid sa la le ba'o //
translated: the root of counsel is as follows: it is the non-delusion and non-confusion regarding the path that is completely and totally unmixed.

original: langka'i bdag po /
analyzed: langka'i bdag po /
translated: Lord of Lanka,🔽the root of means is as follows:

original: thabs @304a *// kyi rtsa ba ni 'di ltar gang yongs su rdzogs pa la rnam par dag pa nyid do //
analyzed: thabs @304a *// kyi rtsa ba ni 'di ltar gang yongs su rdzogs pa la rnam par dag pa nyid do //
translated: The root of method is as follows: that which is perfected is purity.

original: langka'i bdag po /
analyzed: langka'i bdag po /
translated: Lord of Laṅkā,

original: de dag ni rtsa ba ste /
analyzed: de dag ni rtsa ba ste /
translated: these are the roots.

original: rtsa ba gsum po 'di dag ni 'byed pa'i lde mig ces bya ste /
analyzed: rtsa ba gsum po 'di dag ni 'byed pa'i lde mig ces bya ste /
translated: These three roots are called the key to unlocking the door.

original: gang spyod pas 'dren pa'i sgo gang yin pa de ni des 'byed cing de nyid du gsal bar byed do //
analyzed: gang spyod pas 'dren pa'i sgo gang yin pa de ni des 'byed cing de nyid du gsal bar byed do //
translated: The door through which one is led by conduct is opened by that, and it is revealed in just that way.

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi dgongs pa 'dus pa'i mdo chen po las; bkod pa rnam par 'grel pa'i le'u ste bzhi bcu rtsa lnga pa'o ////🔽de nas langka'i mnga' bdag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des gsang ba pa'i bdag po la sgo gnyis kyi dri ba yongs su dris pa /🔽kye gsang ba pa'i bdag po /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi dgongs pa 'dus pa'i mdo chen po las; bkod pa rnam par 'grel pa'i le'u ste bzhi bcu rtsa lnga pa'o //// de nas langka'i mnga' bdag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des gsang ba pa'i bdag po la sgo gnyis kyi dri ba yongs su dris pa / kye gsang ba pa'i bdag po /
translated: CHAPTER XLV🔽THE TWO DOORS

original: gang sgo gnyis 'byed cing rnam par 'grel pa ji ltar 'byed pa lags /
analyzed: gang sgo gnyis 'byed cing rnam par 'grel pa ji ltar 'byed pa lags /
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva lord of Laṅkā asked the lord of guhyakas, “O lord of guhyakas, how do you open and explain the two doors?”

original: smras pa / langka'i bdag po /
analyzed: smras pa / langka'i bdag po /
translated: He replied, “Lord of Laṅkā,

original: sgo gnyis ni 'di ltar 'di'ang lde mig gsum gyis rnam par 'byed cing gsal bar byed pa ste thun mong gi yan lag dang / mdo dang / rtsa ba'o //
analyzed: sgo gnyis ni 'di ltar 'di'ang lde mig gsum gyis rnam par 'byed cing gsal bar byed pa ste thun mong gi yan lag dang / mdo dang / rtsa ba'o //
translated: This is also elucidated and clarified by three keys: the common branches, the sutras, and the root.

original: gang 'di ltar yan lag drug ni /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: gang 'di ltar yan lag drug ni / 'di lta ste /
translated: The six branches are as follows:

original: bya ba'i yan lag dang / thabs kyi yan lag dang / sbyor ba'i yan lag dang / spyod pa'i yan lag dang / rig pa'i yan lag dang / rdzogs pa'i yan lag go /
analyzed: bya ba'i yan lag dang / thabs kyi yan lag dang / sbyor ba'i yan lag dang / spyod pa'i yan lag dang / rig pa'i yan lag dang / rdzogs pa'i yan lag go /
translated: The six branches are the branch of activity, the branch of method, the branch of application, the branch of conduct, the branch of vidyā, and the branch of perfection.

original: langka'i bdag po /
analyzed: langka'i bdag po /
translated: O Lord of Laṅka,🔽these six branches are also complete with twelve branches and are elucidated with six branches.

original: yan lag drug po 'di dag kyang gcig tu yan lag bcu gnyis kyis yongs su rdzogs shing yan lag drug @304b gis gsal bar 'grel pa ste bcu gnyis gang zhe na /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: yan lag drug po 'di dag kyang gcig tu yan lag bcu gnyis kyis yongs su rdzogs shing yan lag drug @304b gis gsal bar 'grel pa ste bcu gnyis gang zhe na /🔽'di lta ste /
translated: What are the twelve?

original: sgo'i yan lag dang / dam pa'i yan lag dang / nges pa'i yan lag dang / bsam pa'i yan lag dang / dmigs pa'i yan lag dang / bzlas pa'i yan lag dang / sbyor ba'i yan lag dang / spyod pa'i yan lag dang / thob pa'i yan lag dang /
analyzed: sgo'i yan lag dang / dam pa'i yan lag dang / nges pa'i yan lag dang / bsam pa'i yan lag dang / dmigs pa'i yan lag dang / bzlas pa'i yan lag dang / sbyor ba'i yan lag dang / spyod pa'i yan lag dang / thob pa'i yan lag dang /
translated: the branch of the door, the branch of the sublime, the branch of ascertainment, the branch of thought, the branch of observation, the branch of recitation, the branch of application, the branch of conduct, the branch of attainment,

original: gnas pa'i yan lag dang / sa'i yan lag dang / lta ba'i yan lag go /
analyzed: gnas pa'i yan lag dang / sa'i yan lag dang / lta ba'i yan lag go /
translated: the branch of abiding, the branch of the stages, and the branch of views.

original: langka'i bdag po /
analyzed: langka'i bdag po /
translated: Lord of Laṅkā,

original: drug gang zhe na /
analyzed: drug gang zhe na /
translated: what are the six?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: rgyu'i yan lag dang / rtsa ba'i yan lag dang / 'brel ba'i yan lag dang / 'dren pa'i yan lag dang / nges pa'i yan lag dang / sbyor ba'i yan lag go /
analyzed: rgyu'i yan lag dang / rtsa ba'i yan lag dang / 'brel ba'i yan lag dang / 'dren pa'i yan lag dang / nges pa'i yan lag dang / sbyor ba'i yan lag go /
translated: the branch of the cause, the branch of the root, the branch of connection, the branch of guidance, the branch of ascertainment, and the branch of application.

original: langka'i bdag po /
analyzed: langka'i bdag po /
translated: Lord of Laṅkā,

original: 'di dag ni gang thams cad nas thams cad du thun mong du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni gang thams cad nas thams cad du thun mong du shes par bya'o //
translated: these should be understood as common to all.

original: langka'i bdag po /
analyzed: langka'i bdag po /
translated: Lord of Laṅkā,

original: de dag ni yan lag ste; gang sgo de dag de dag gis 'byed cing gsal bar 'grel bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni yan lag ste; gang sgo de dag de dag gis 'byed cing gsal bar 'grel bar shes par bya'o //
translated: those should be understood as branches, which are the doors that open and clarify them.

original: langka'i bdag po /
analyzed: langka'i bdag po /
translated: “Lord of Lanka,

original: de la mdo gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la mdo gang zhe na /
translated: what is a sutra?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: skye ba med pa dang / mnyam pa nyid dang / ji bzhin pa dang / btsal ba med par lung ston pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba med pa dang / mnyam pa nyid dang / ji bzhin pa dang / btsal ba med par lung ston pa'o //
translated: it is a discourse on non-arising, equality, the way things are, and the absence of investigation.

original: lang ka'i bdag po /
analyzed: lang ka'i bdag po /
translated: Lord of Lanka,

original: de dag ni gzhan gyi skye ba med pa dang / mnyam pa nyid dang / ji bzhin pa dang / btsal ba med pa dang / ma 'dres pa gang yin pa de kho na nyid do //
analyzed: de dag ni gzhan gyi skye ba med pa dang / mnyam pa nyid dang / ji bzhin pa dang / btsal ba med pa dang / ma 'dres pa gang yin pa de kho na nyid do //
translated: those are the suchness, the absence of other arising, equality, the way things are, the absence of investigation, and the absence of mixture.

original: langka'i bdag po /
analyzed: langka'i bdag po /
translated: Lord of Lanka,

original: de la rtsa ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la rtsa ba gang zhe na /
translated: what is a root?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: de kho na nyid gang yin pa dang / dam par nges pa dang / yongs su @305a *//
analyzed: de kho na nyid gang yin pa dang / dam par nges pa dang / yongs su @305a *//
translated: it is the suchness, the highest certainty, and the complete🔽understanding.

original: zin pa'o // langka'i bdag po /
analyzed: zin pa'o // langka'i bdag po /
translated: Lord of Lanka,

original: de dag ni rtsa ba ste /
analyzed: de dag ni rtsa ba ste /
translated: those are the roots.

original: des sgo de dag gi ji lta ba nges par 'byin par shes par bya'o //🔽sangs rgyas kun gyi dgongs pa 'dus pa'i mdo chen po las /
analyzed: des sgo de dag gi ji lta ba nges par 'byin par shes par bya'o // sangs rgyas kun gyi dgongs pa 'dus pa'i mdo chen po las /
translated: One should understand that they are the doors to the ascertainment of the way things are.

original: bsdu ba rnam par 'grel ba'i le'u ste bzhi bcu rtsa drug pa'o ////
analyzed: bsdu ba rnam par 'grel ba'i le'u ste bzhi bcu rtsa drug pa'o ////
translated: This concludes the forty-sixth chapter, on the analysis of the collections, from The Great Assembly Sutra of the Embodiment of the Wisdom of All Buddhas.

original: de nas yang gsang ba pa'i bdag pos langka'i bdag po la bos te smras pa /
analyzed: de nas yang gsang ba pa'i bdag pos langka'i bdag po la bos te smras pa /
translated: Then, the Lord of Secrets addressed the Lord of Laṅka:

original: lang ka'i bdag po /
analyzed: lang ka'i bdag po /
translated: “Lord of Laṅka!

original: de dag las khyad par du nges pa'i gsang sgo lde mig gsum gyis 'byed pa yang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de dag las khyad par du nges pa'i gsang sgo lde mig gsum gyis 'byed pa yang 'di lta ste /
translated: In particular, the three keys that open the secret door are as follows:

original: dam pa rnams kyi gsang ba'i sgo //
analyzed: dam pa rnams kyi gsang ba'i sgo //
translated: The secret door of the sublime ones

original: yan lag mdo dang rtsa ba yi //
analyzed: yan lag mdo dang rtsa ba yi //
translated: Is opened by the root and the branches.🔽The root is the key that opens the door,🔽The branches are the key that releases the seal,

original: 'byed 'grol nges par 'byin pa yis //
analyzed: 'byed 'grol nges par 'byin pa yis //
translated: And the summary is the key that definitely extracts.

original: de nyid nges par mthong ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid nges par mthong ba'o //
translated: By those three, the definitive meaning is seen.🔽The root is opened by the cause,

original: 'byed pa rgyu dang rtsa ba dang // 'brel pa'i tshig dang nges pa dang // sbyor bas yan lag rdzogs pa yin //
analyzed: 'byed pa rgyu dang rtsa ba dang // 'brel pa'i tshig dang nges pa dang // sbyor bas yan lag rdzogs pa yin //
translated: The branches are opened by the words of connection, certainty, and application.🔽The summary is the perfection of the branches.

original: brjod 'byung kun la nges par 'gro /
analyzed: brjod 'byung kun la nges par 'gro /
translated: The summary is the definitive meaning that arises from expression.

original: rgyu bzhi gang byung ched phyir na //
analyzed: rgyu bzhi gang byung ched phyir na //
translated: The four causes are the reason for the purpose.

original: rgyu yi ngo bo byin gyis brlabs //
analyzed: rgyu yi ngo bo byin gyis brlabs //
translated: The essence of the cause is the blessing.

original: lung bstan nyid du nges par snang //
analyzed: lung bstan nyid du nges par snang //
translated: The prophecy is definitely seen.

original: rtsa ba'i yan lag gang dag gis //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i yan lag gang dag gis //
translated: The root branches are the four:

original: mdun bsu gus dang dri ba dris //
analyzed: mdun bsu gus dang dri ba dris //
translated: Welcoming, respect, asking questions,

original: skabs las gleng du langs pa'o //
analyzed: skabs las gleng du langs pa'o //
translated: And speaking from the context.

original: 'brel pa yan lag rnam pa bzhi //
analyzed: 'brel pa yan lag rnam pa bzhi //
translated: The four branches of connection are:

original: rjod dang brjod bya 'brel dgongs las //
analyzed: rjod dang brjod bya 'brel dgongs las //
translated: The intention of the connection between the expression and the expressed.🔽

original: tha ma gnyis bzhir 'dren pa'o //
analyzed: tha ma gnyis bzhir 'dren pa'o //
translated: The last two are drawn as four.

original: 'dren pa gang 'dir rnam pa bcu //
analyzed: 'dren pa gang 'dir rnam pa bcu //
translated: The drawing here is of ten kinds.🔽View, opening the door, general summary, and drawing in the wealth

original: lta nyid de bzhin sgo 'byed dang // spyir sdud pa dang 'byor bar 'dren //
analyzed: lta nyid de bzhin sgo 'byed dang // spyir sdud pa dang 'byor bar 'dren //
translated: .🔽One's own condition, indirect intention, and the very essence

original: rang rkyen ldem dgongs gal po nyid //
analyzed: rang rkyen ldem dgongs gal po nyid //
translated: .🔽Unfabricated, the example that illustrates reality

original: @305b ma bcos de nyid mtshon pa'i dpe //🔽cho rol snel zhing rnam pa bcu //
analyzed: @305b ma bcos de nyid mtshon pa'i dpe // cho rol snel zhing rnam pa bcu //
translated: .🔽Play, and ten kinds of drawing in.

original: me long bcu dang rnam sbyor bas //
analyzed: me long bcu dang rnam sbyor bas //
translated: The ten mirrors are applied.

original: sgron mas mun pa'i rdzas tshol sbyar //
analyzed: sgron mas mun pa'i rdzas tshol sbyar //
translated: The lamp is applied to seek out the substance of darkness.

original: nges pa bzhi bzhi bzhir sbyar bas //
analyzed: nges pa bzhi bzhi bzhir sbyar bas //
translated: The four certainties are applied as four.

original: bcu gnyis yan lag bzhir kun snang //
analyzed: bcu gnyis yan lag bzhir kun snang //
translated: The twelve are all appearances in four.

original: sbyor ba bzhi pa lnga gnyis bzhi //
analyzed: sbyor ba bzhi pa lnga gnyis bzhi //
translated: The four applications are five, two, and four.

original: yan lag lngar snang de sbyar lnga //
analyzed: yan lag lngar snang de sbyar lnga //
translated: The five appearances are applied as five.

original: rtog 'jug drug cu gcig thabs dang // yan lag drug tu rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: rtog 'jug drug cu gcig thabs dang // yan lag drug tu rdzogs pa'o //
translated: The sixty-one methods of engaging concepts are perfected in six branches.

original: lang ka'i bdag po /🔽gang 'dir yan lag drug ni /
analyzed: lang ka'i bdag po / gang 'dir yan lag drug ni /
translated: Lord of Lanka!🔽Here, the six branches are as follows:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: The six are as follows:

original: rgyu'i yan lag dang / rtsa ba'i yan lag dang / 'brel pa'i yan lag dang / 'dren pa'i yan lag dang / nges pa'i yan lag dang / sbyor ba'i yan lag go //
analyzed: rgyu'i yan lag dang / rtsa ba'i yan lag dang / 'brel pa'i yan lag dang / 'dren pa'i yan lag dang / nges pa'i yan lag dang / sbyor ba'i yan lag go //
translated: the causal factor, the fundamental factor, the related factor, the guiding factor, the definitive factor, and the factor of application.

original: lang ka'i bdag po /
analyzed: lang ka'i bdag po /
translated: Lord of Lanka,

original: de la rgyu'i yan lag ni gang 'byung ba'i rgyur gyur pa ste /
analyzed: de la rgyu'i yan lag ni gang 'byung ba'i rgyur gyur pa ste /
translated: the causal factor is that which becomes the cause of arising.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: yongs su rdzogs pa drug go /
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs pa drug go /
translated: the six perfections.

original: lang ka'i bdag po; de'ang 'di ltar /
analyzed: lang ka'i bdag po; de'ang 'di ltar /
translated: Lord of Lanka, it is like this:

original: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa kho na nyid nges par snang ba'i dus gcig na /
analyzed: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa kho na nyid nges par snang ba'i dus gcig na /
translated: At one time, when the reality of the Tathāgata was appearing,

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thugs dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya ba tha snyad dang bral ba /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thugs dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya ba tha snyad dang bral ba /
translated: the Bhagavān, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One, called “the mind of all tathāgatas,” free from conventions,

original: bla dvags thams cad las 'das pa /
analyzed: bla dvags thams cad las 'das pa /
translated: beyond all metaphors,

original: nam mkha' chen po kun la khyab pa'i bdag nyid mngon sum mi gnas mtshon du med pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i rgyal po des yongs su khyab pa'i gnas rdzogs pa'i spyir chib ces bya ba nam mkha'i dbyings bde ba chen po'i ngang /🔽thams cad sangs rgyas la @306a *//🔽mkhyen par dgod pa /
analyzed: nam mkha' chen po kun la khyab pa'i bdag nyid mngon sum mi gnas mtshon du med pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i rgyal po des yongs su khyab pa'i gnas rdzogs pa'i spyir chib ces bya ba nam mkha'i dbyings bde ba chen po'i ngang / thams cad sangs rgyas la @306a *// mkhyen par dgod pa /
translated: The king of total perfection, the nature that pervades the great, all-pervading space, is not present in a direct perception, and is inexpressible.

original: kun gzhi chos kyi pho brang ye 'byam rmad du grags pa /
analyzed: kun gzhi chos kyi pho brang ye 'byam rmad du grags pa /
translated: The “universal ground” is the palace of phenomena, renowned as “timeless.”

original: rgya phyogs su yongs su ma chad pa /
analyzed: rgya phyogs su yongs su ma chad pa /
translated: It is not limited in any direction.

original: chos nyid kyi nam mkha' brjod du med pa la ye shes kyi nyi ma dpag tu med par shar ba /
analyzed: chos nyid kyi nam mkha' brjod du med pa la ye shes kyi nyi ma dpag tu med par shar ba /
translated: The sun of timeless awareness rises in the sky of the nature of phenomena, which is inexpressible, in an immeasurable way.🔽In the realm known as “the great expanse, infinitely vast and even,”

original: mtha' dang / dbus med cing kun tu rgya mnyam pa bdal khyab chen po zhes bya ba'i zhing khams na /
analyzed: mtha' dang / dbus med cing kun tu rgya mnyam pa bdal khyab chen po zhes bya ba'i zhing khams na /
translated: which has no periphery or center,

original: gang du'ang mi gnas pa chen po /
analyzed: gang du'ang mi gnas pa chen po /
translated: there is a “great absence of location,”

original: gang la'ang mi chags chags pa'i bdag nyid /
analyzed: gang la'ang mi chags chags pa'i bdag nyid /
translated: a “nature that is not attached to anything,”

original: ci la'ang mi mdzad mdzad pa thams cad lhun gyis grub /
analyzed: ci la'ang mi mdzad mdzad pa thams cad lhun gyis grub /
translated: and “no action whatsoever, with all action spontaneously accomplished.”

original: mi skye mi 'gag rnam grol rnam dag /
analyzed: mi skye mi 'gag rnam grol rnam dag /
translated: It is unborn and unceasing, liberated and pure.

original: dngos por ma yin nam mkha'i rang bzhin /
analyzed: dngos por ma yin nam mkha'i rang bzhin /
translated: It is not substantial, but has the nature of space.

original: ma bcos ma byas ye nas ji bzhin /
analyzed: ma bcos ma byas ye nas ji bzhin /
translated: It is uncontrived and unfabricated, timelessly just as it is.

original: 'khor ba mi spong ye nas ji bzhin /
analyzed: 'khor ba mi spong ye nas ji bzhin /
translated: Samsara is not renounced, but is timelessly just as it is.

original: 'khor ba mi sbong ye bdal khyab pa /
analyzed: 'khor ba mi sbong ye bdal khyab pa /
translated: Samsara is not expanded, but is timelessly expansive and pervasive.

original: dug gsum mi spong sman pa chen po /
analyzed: dug gsum mi spong sman pa chen po /
translated: The three poisons are not renounced, but are the greatest of medicines.

original: cir yang mi dmigs dmigs pa kun 'byung /
analyzed: cir yang mi dmigs dmigs pa kun 'byung /
translated: Nothing need be visualized, yet everything arises as visualization.

original: tshig gi lam chad brjod pa kun 'byung /
analyzed: tshig gi lam chad brjod pa kun 'byung /
translated: The path of words is cut through, yet everything arises as expression.

original: gang dang ma 'dres gcig tu yongs su rdzogs pa /
analyzed: gang dang ma 'dres gcig tu yongs su rdzogs pa /
translated: It is totally perfect in oneness, unadulterated by anything.

original: kun nas kun tu dang / bzang po mi nub pa'i tog chen por ye shes brjod kyis mi lang pa'i yang mi lang ba dang / 'du 'bral med par kun tu 'ub chub ste dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du bzhugs so //
analyzed: kun nas kun tu dang / bzang po mi nub pa'i tog chen por ye shes brjod kyis mi lang pa'i yang mi lang ba dang / 'du 'bral med par kun tu 'ub chub ste dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du bzhugs so //
translated: It is totally and completely perfect, the great, never-setting, supreme emblem of goodness, beyond even the most extravagant expression of ineffable timeless awareness, without any coming together or separation, totally and completely perfect, abiding in the essence that is not some thing.🔽This is the secret heart essence, the very heart of thatness.

original: gsang ba'i snying po de kho na nyid kyi tshig 'di skad mthun 'jug thabs su thos pa'i dus gcig na /
analyzed: gsang ba'i snying po de kho na nyid kyi tshig 'di skad mthun 'jug thabs su thos pa'i dus gcig na /
translated: At one time, in a state of harmony with what is heard through the skillful means of engagement, the following words were uttered:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bcom ldan 'das gsang ba mchog gi bdag @306b po de blang dor mi mnga' byin gyis brlabs kyi dbang phyug /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bcom ldan 'das gsang ba mchog gi bdag @306b po de blang dor mi mnga' byin gyis brlabs kyi dbang phyug /
translated: The Bhagavat of all the Tathagatas, the Lord of the Supreme Secret, the one who is not subject to adopting and rejecting, the powerful one of blessings,

original: 'dod pa kun 'byung mi zad mdzod kyi bkod pa /
analyzed: 'dod pa kun 'byung mi zad mdzod kyi bkod pa /
translated: the one who is the array of the inexhaustible treasury of the arising of all desires,

original: che ba kun spyod dam par rol pa'i gzi brjid dang / rlabs su gcod pa'i spyod pa chen pos spyod pa de rmad du byung don 'di nyid gleng ba'i gnas /
analyzed: che ba kun spyod dam par rol pa'i gzi brjid dang / rlabs su gcod pa'i spyod pa chen pos spyod pa de rmad du byung don 'di nyid gleng ba'i gnas /
translated: the one who is the splendor of the play of the supreme conduct of greatness, and the one who acts with the great conduct of the waves of the ocean, spoke these marvelous words.

original: tshogs chen rdzogs pa'i gzhi /
analyzed: tshogs chen rdzogs pa'i gzhi /
translated: The place where this was spoken is the basis of the perfection of the great assembly.

original: rtsal chen rdzogs pa'i sa /
analyzed: rtsal chen rdzogs pa'i sa /
translated: The stage of perfecting the great potential.

original: bde ba can zhes bya ba'i zhing khams na 'og min chos kyi dbyings kyi pho brang rin po che sna tshogs kyi gzhal yas khang mtha' dang / dbus med cing rtse mo kun tu rgya mnyam pa /
analyzed: bde ba can zhes bya ba'i zhing khams na 'og min chos kyi dbyings kyi pho brang rin po che sna tshogs kyi gzhal yas khang mtha' dang / dbus med cing rtse mo kun tu rgya mnyam pa /
translated: In the buddhafield called Sukhavati, in the Akanishtha palace of the dharmadhatu, there is a celestial mansion of various jewels without periphery or center, with a perfectly even peak.

original: rin po che'i rgyal pos rnam par brgyan pa /
analyzed: rin po che'i rgyal pos rnam par brgyan pa /
translated: It is adorned with precious jewels.

original: mu tig gi lcang lo dang / chun 'phyang dang / lda ldis mdzes pa /
analyzed: mu tig gi lcang lo dang / chun 'phyang dang / lda ldis mdzes pa /
translated: It is beautified with garlands of pearls, tassels, and streamers.

original: rtsibs kun tu nyi ma dang / zla ba rangs pa dang / ma rangs pa 'phyo bas gsal btab cing phra bkod pa /
analyzed: rtsibs kun tu nyi ma dang / zla ba rangs pa dang / ma rangs pa 'phyo bas gsal btab cing phra bkod pa /
translated: The spokes are all clear with the sun and moon moving in their full and waning phases.🔽

original: skar ma dang / shin du skar ma dag gis gzer spras pa /
analyzed: skar ma dang / shin du skar ma dag gis gzer spras pa /
translated: The spokes are all illuminated by the sun and moon, which are sometimes full and sometimes not, and by the stars and the smaller stars, which are set in the latticework.

original: rin po che'i ka ba brgyad zug pa /
analyzed: rin po che'i ka ba brgyad zug pa /
translated: The palace has eight jeweled pillars,

original: nyi ma dang / zla bas brgyan pa /
analyzed: nyi ma dang / zla bas brgyan pa /
translated: adorned with sun and moon.

original: rin po che'i ka rgyan las rin po che'i gcar dang / 'od zer kun tu 'phro ba /
analyzed: rin po che'i ka rgyan las rin po che'i gcar dang / 'od zer kun tu 'phro ba /
translated: The jeweled ornaments on the pillars emit jeweled light rays that shine everywhere.

original: gdung chen po brgyad re'u res bres pa /
analyzed: gdung chen po brgyad re'u res bres pa /
translated: The eight great beams are crossed by latticework.

original: chos nyid kyi bla re la rdo rje'i shar bu byung ba /
analyzed: chos nyid kyi bla re la rdo rje'i shar bu byung ba /
translated: The Dharma nature canopy has vajra tassels.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi sprin phung gtibs pa /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi sprin phung gtibs pa /
translated: It is covered with clouds of miracles.

original: byang chub kyi char mngon par 'bab pa /
analyzed: byang chub kyi char mngon par 'bab pa /
translated: The rain of awakening falls upon it.🔽The torment of afflictions is cleared away, and the sprouts of wisdom are produced.

original: nyon mongs pa'i gdung ba sangs par gyur pa; ye shes kyi myu gu mngon par bskyed pa dang / chos nyid sgra mngon par sgrogs pa las kun gzhi ye 'byam rmad du grags pa'i gleng slong ba /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i gdung ba sangs par gyur pa; ye shes kyi myu gu mngon par bskyed pa dang / chos nyid sgra mngon par sgrogs pa las kun gzhi ye 'byam rmad du grags pa'i gleng slong ba /
translated: The sound of the Dharma nature proclaims the marvelous renown of the all-encompassing ground of being.

original: tshig gi brjod pa dang bral zhing @307a *//
analyzed: tshig gi brjod pa dang bral zhing @307a *//
translated: It is beyond verbal expression.

original: bzhin dang / me long gi tshul ltar snang ba /
analyzed: bzhin dang / me long gi tshul ltar snang ba /
translated: The appearance is like a face in a mirror.

original: gzhal yas khang rdo rje mngon par dga' ba /
analyzed: gzhal yas khang rdo rje mngon par dga' ba /
translated: The celestial mansion is the manifest joy of the vajra.

original: rdo rjes rnam par brgyan pa /
analyzed: rdo rjes rnam par brgyan pa /
translated: It is adorned with vajras.

original: rin po che sna tshogs las grub pa /
analyzed: rin po che sna tshogs las grub pa /
translated: It is made of various jewels.

original: gser gyis gzhi bdal ba /🔽me long ngam /
analyzed: gser gyis gzhi bdal ba / me long ngam /
translated: The ground is covered with gold.🔽It is like a mirror,

original: chu shel lam /
analyzed: chu shel lam /
translated: crystal,

original: chu dang ba 'am /
analyzed: chu dang ba 'am /
translated: clear water,🔽or refined gold. It is even, smooth, clear, and radiant.

original: gser shin tu sbyangs pa ltar mnyam zhing snyoms la gsal zhing 'tsher ba las gzugs brnyan byung ba /🔽nem pa / 'phar ba /🔽'jam pa / dag pa /
analyzed: gser shin tu sbyangs pa ltar mnyam zhing snyoms la gsal zhing 'tsher ba las gzugs brnyan byung ba / nem pa / 'phar ba / 'jam pa / dag pa /
translated: The images arise from it.🔽It is soft,🔽smooth,

original: dang ba / ldem pa /
analyzed: dang ba / ldem pa /
translated: pliant,🔽blazing,

original: mnyen pa / 'bar ba /
analyzed: mnyen pa / 'bar ba /
translated: radiant,

original: 'phro ba / rtog pa med pa /
analyzed: 'phro ba / rtog pa med pa /
translated: and nonconceptual.

original: rin po che sna tshogs kyi 'od rang bzhin gyis byung zhing zer kun tu 'phro bas phyi nang gi mun pa yongs su sel ba /
analyzed: rin po che sna tshogs kyi 'od rang bzhin gyis byung zhing zer kun tu 'phro bas phyi nang gi mun pa yongs su sel ba /
translated: The light of various jewels arises by nature, and since the rays radiate everywhere, they completely clear away outer and inner darkness.

original: dbu rtse 'khor lo rtsibs bzhir 'bar ba /
analyzed: dbu rtse 'khor lo rtsibs bzhir 'bar ba /
translated: The peak of the palace is a blazing four-petaled lotus.

original: rdo rjes kun tu spras pa /
analyzed: rdo rjes kun tu spras pa /
translated: It is completely adorned with vajras.

original: sgo gsum kun tu gsal ba la /
analyzed: sgo gsum kun tu gsal ba la /
translated: The three doors are completely clear.

original: ba ti 'od kyi mu khyud yongs su ma chad pa /
analyzed: ba ti 'od kyi mu khyud yongs su ma chad pa /
translated: The outer rim of light is unbroken.

original: nyi zla'i ga'u sum rgyud zung sgril du 'bar ba /
analyzed: nyi zla'i ga'u sum rgyud zung sgril du 'bar ba /
translated: The sun and moon are blazing in the three-layered double-hinged door.

original: them skas dang / rta babs kyis brgyan pa /
analyzed: them skas dang / rta babs kyis brgyan pa /
translated: It is adorned with stairs and archways.

original: bar khyams kyis mdzes pa /
analyzed: bar khyams kyis mdzes pa /
translated: It is beautified with balconies.

original: ha ra dang / ha ra chen pos brgyan pa /
analyzed: ha ra dang / ha ra chen pos brgyan pa /
translated: It is adorned with small and large railings.

original: tva ra na yis bzung ba /
analyzed: tva ra na yis bzung ba /
translated: It is held up by tvaṃraṇas.

original: phreng bas mdzes pa /
analyzed: phreng bas mdzes pa /
translated: It is beautified with garlands.

original: dra ba dang / dra ba phyed pas brgyan pa /
analyzed: dra ba dang / dra ba phyed pas brgyan pa /
translated: It is adorned with nets and half-nets.

original: za ra tshags kyis bklubs pa /
analyzed: za ra tshags kyis bklubs pa /
translated: It is covered with hanging tassels.

original: rdo rje rin po che 'bar bas kun tu mdangs phyung ba /
analyzed: rdo rje rin po che 'bar bas kun tu mdangs phyung ba /
translated: It is radiant with blazing vajra jewels.

original: dril bu g-yer ka las theg pa chen po chos kyi sgra sgrogs pa /
analyzed: dril bu g-yer ka las theg pa chen po chos kyi sgra sgrogs pa /
translated: It resounds with the sound of the Mahāyāna Dharma from the ringing of little bells.

original: chos kyi sku'i gzugs brnyan 'byung ba /
analyzed: chos kyi sku'i gzugs brnyan 'byung ba /
translated: It is the source of the reflection of the dharmakāya.

original: gzhi yongs su mdzes pa'i rgyan rdo rje mu khyud ma chad pas @307b rdo rje 'greng bu dang / dra bas brgyan pa /
analyzed: gzhi yongs su mdzes pa'i rgyan rdo rje mu khyud ma chad pas @307b rdo rje 'greng bu dang / dra bas brgyan pa /
translated: The ground is beautified with a continuous vajra garland of unbroken vajra pillars and nets.

original: ta la'i shing ljon pa skyes pa la gser gyi tsong tsong bres pa /
analyzed: ta la'i shing ljon pa skyes pa la gser gyi tsong tsong bres pa /
translated: Palm trees grow there, with golden bells hanging from them.

original: rin po che'i phra mig gis spras pa /
analyzed: rin po che'i phra mig gis spras pa /
translated: It is adorned with precious small windows.

original: bdud rtsi'i chu rgyun 'bab pa /
analyzed: bdud rtsi'i chu rgyun 'bab pa /
translated: A stream of nectar flows there.

original: phyi dang / nang med kun yang nang du gyur pa na /
analyzed: phyi dang / nang med kun yang nang du gyur pa na /
translated: Since there is no outer or inner, everything is also inner.

original: gar yang ma 'gags snang ba chen po /
analyzed: gar yang ma 'gags snang ba chen po /
translated: Since there is no obstruction anywhere, there is great appearance.

original: ci yang ma gsungs rgya cher bshad pa /
analyzed: ci yang ma gsungs rgya cher bshad pa /
translated: Since there is nothing to explain, there is great explanation.🔽Since there is no thought of anything, there is the king of the great samādhi, the perfection of the power of the great, perfect enjoyment.

original: gang la'ang mi dgongs ting nge 'dzin chen po mnga' thang yongs su rdzogs pa'i rgyal po de rdzogs longs spyod pa'i 'khor brjod kyis mi lang ba'i yang mi lang ba la /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: gang la'ang mi dgongs ting nge 'dzin chen po mnga' thang yongs su rdzogs pa'i rgyal po de rdzogs longs spyod pa'i 'khor brjod kyis mi lang ba'i yang mi lang ba la / 'di lta ste /
translated: To the retinue of the great, perfect enjoyment, which is beyond inexpressible, there are the following:🔽the tathāgatas of the vajra family, such as the tathāgata Akṣobhya, the king of consciousness, and all the buddhas of the family;🔽the tathāgatas of the maṇi family, such as the tathāgata Mahāsaṃnāhasaṃbodhy, the king of sensation, and all the buddhas of the family;

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par shes pa'i rgyal po mi bskyod pa la sogs pa rdo rje gdung dang / sde'i sangs rgyas thams cad dang / de bzhin gshegs pa tshor ba'i rgyal po btang snyoms chen po la sogs pa nor bu'i gdung dang / sde'i sangs rgyas thams cad dang; de bzhin gshegs pa 'du shes kyi rgyal po mtshan ma med pa la sogs pa padma'i gdung dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par shes pa'i rgyal po mi bskyod pa la sogs pa rdo rje gdung dang / sde'i sangs rgyas thams cad dang / de bzhin gshegs pa tshor ba'i rgyal po btang snyoms chen po la sogs pa nor bu'i gdung dang / sde'i sangs rgyas thams cad dang; de bzhin gshegs pa 'du shes kyi rgyal po mtshan ma med pa la sogs pa padma'i gdung dang /
translated: and the tathāgatas of the padma family, such as the tathāgata Anābhilapyānanuvyajana, the king of discernment, and all the buddhas of the family.

original: sde'i sangs rgyas thams cad dang / de bzhin gshegs pa 'du byed kyi rgyal po sems dpa' chen po la sogs pa gzhon nu'i gdung dang / sde'i sangs rgyas thams cad dang / de bzhin gshegs pa gzugs kyi rgyal po rnams mi rig la sogs pa glang po'i gdung dang /🔽sde'i sangs rgyas thams cad kun kyang thabs sprin phung lta bu dang / shes rab nam mkha' lta bur 'brel ba sha dag dang / gtso bo dang / 'khor gyi tshul @308a *//
analyzed: sde'i sangs rgyas thams cad dang / de bzhin gshegs pa 'du byed kyi rgyal po sems dpa' chen po la sogs pa gzhon nu'i gdung dang / sde'i sangs rgyas thams cad dang / de bzhin gshegs pa gzugs kyi rgyal po rnams mi rig la sogs pa glang po'i gdung dang / sde'i sangs rgyas thams cad kun kyang thabs sprin phung lta bu dang / shes rab nam mkha' lta bur 'brel ba sha dag dang / gtso bo dang / 'khor gyi tshul @308a *//
translated: The tathāgatas of the class of the great being King of Composition and so on, the youth lineage;🔽the tathāgatas of the class of the great being King of Form and so on, the elephant lineage;

original: du rdzogs longs spyod par bzhugs so //
analyzed: du rdzogs longs spyod par bzhugs so //
translated: and the tathāgatas of the class of the great being King of the Mind and so on, the lion lineage—all the buddhas of the classes—abide in perfect enjoyment in the manner of the principal ones and retinues, with the pure connection of method like a mass of clouds and wisdom like the sky.

original: rgya cher brjod pa ldem dgongs sbyor ba'i tshig 'di skad du bkri ba'i thabs su thos pa dus gcig na /
analyzed: rgya cher brjod pa ldem dgongs sbyor ba'i tshig 'di skad du bkri ba'i thabs su thos pa dus gcig na /
translated: This is the method of guidance through the words of the tantra of the extensive explanation of the application of the intention.

original: bcom ldan 'das cho 'phrul chen po cir yang snang ba'i rgyal po rnams ni bya ba rdzogs pa'i gnas bsod nams gter zhes bya ba 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med pa gnas ji bzhin pa mos pa can zhes bya ba'i zhing khams na 'khor ba 'dren pa'i
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das cho 'phrul chen po cir yang snang ba'i rgyal po rnams ni bya ba rdzogs pa'i gnas bsod nams gter zhes bya ba 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med pa gnas ji bzhin pa mos pa can zhes bya ba'i zhing khams na 'khor ba 'dren pa'i
translated: The Bhagavān, the king of the great miracles that appear in any way, is in the place where activity is complete called “Treasure of Merit,” in the world system called “Faithful,” which is an immeasurable world system that is just like the realm called “Land of Faith.”🔽The Buddha who guides saṃsāra,

original: sangs rgyas dang / snang srid ston pa'i sgron ma /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang / snang srid ston pa'i sgron ma /
translated: the lamp that illuminates the world,

original: gdul ba sel ba'i sems dpa'/
analyzed: gdul ba sel ba'i sems dpa'/
translated: the bodhisattva who clears away those to be tamed,🔽the ārya who performs benefit for migrating beings,

original: 'gro don mdzad pa'i 'phags pa; thabs mkhas thugs rje'i sprul pa /
analyzed: 'gro don mdzad pa'i 'phags pa; thabs mkhas thugs rje'i sprul pa /
translated: the emanation of skillful compassion,

original: 'byung ba rgyun gyi bcom ldan 'das thugs rje rtag pa'i bdag nyid chen por sprul pa de 'khor brjod kyis mi lang ba'i yang mi lang ba dag dang / ston pa dang / nyan pa'i tshul du rnam par bshad pa chen por bzhugs te thams cad bden pa gnyis kyi tshul du snang bar ston 'dod pa rang rkyen gyi tshig 'di skad du ma bkag chos nyid du dgongs pa rang snang thos pa'i dus gcig na /🔽bcom ldan 'das gsang ba'i sku bde ba chen po de cho 'phrul yongs su rdzogs pa'i gnas /🔽gtsug tor 'khor los bsgyur ba'i khyad par zab mo gsang ba mchog gi dgyes pa yum gyis lhums padma'i snying po rgyal ba kun gyi skrun pa'i pho brang /
analyzed: 'byung ba rgyun gyi bcom ldan 'das thugs rje rtag pa'i bdag nyid chen por sprul pa de 'khor brjod kyis mi lang ba'i yang mi lang ba dag dang / ston pa dang / nyan pa'i tshul du rnam par bshad pa chen por bzhugs te thams cad bden pa gnyis kyi tshul du snang bar ston 'dod pa rang rkyen gyi tshig 'di skad du ma bkag chos nyid du dgongs pa rang snang thos pa'i dus gcig na / bcom ldan 'das gsang ba'i sku bde ba chen po de cho 'phrul yongs su rdzogs pa'i gnas / gtsug tor 'khor los bsgyur ba'i khyad par zab mo gsang ba mchog gi dgyes pa yum gyis lhums padma'i snying po rgyal ba kun gyi skrun pa'i pho brang /
translated: The emanation of the great lord of the constant compassion of the transcendent conqueror of the continuum of the elements exists as the great explanation with inexpressibly inexpressible retinues in the manner of teacher and listener.

original: gang gi don la gshegs @308b ba'i shul /🔽srid pa gsum gyi sems can smin par byed pa'i gzhi /
analyzed: gang gi don la gshegs @308b ba'i shul /🔽srid pa gsum gyi sems can smin par byed pa'i gzhi /
translated: The one who wishes to teach that all appearances are the mode of the two truths, the one who is not obstructed by the words of his own conditions, the one who is the transcendent conqueror of the dharmatā of the unfabricated nature, the one who is the transcendent conqueror of the nature of phenomena, the one who is the transcendent conqueror of the nature of the mind, the one who is the transcendent conqueror of the nature of the dhātu, the one who is the transcendent conqueror of the nature of the basis, the one who is the transcendent conqueror of the nature of the result, the
